column4: Hi. I just installed ubuntu and I'm trying to figure out how to install zlib with apt-get.
I don't have X11 installed. I don't want to use Synaptic or whatever it's called.
it seems that zlibc was what I needed
I've never used a debian-based distribution before, so this apt stuff is new to me
- I'm just trying to make this go away
oh. You're trying to link against it
when you want to compile something against a given library, you need the version from a package ending in -dev
hmm, should I stick '-dev' on the end of eveyrhing i wanna link against?
ah, you answered before I asked.
usually it's libfoo-dev, but zlib is oh so very ancient and special :)
